page.title: 06SQUARE CORNER, UFFCULME
page.content: The{Square Corner}was built around{1785}and was purchased by the {Parish Church in 1971. It is used for a general meeting place for several{village activities and{social gatherings}(e.g. Bible Club, Day Centre for elderly, W.I. and British Legion). With its central location it is often hired for{Coffee {Mornings}for fund raising by many {local organisations.}The{Vicar and the{Uffculme Housing Trust}both have offices upstairs. It does not make a profit or a loss but aims to cover day to day running costs from hire fees. Major repairs are paid for by the Church. In the past it has been a cottage, a tailors shop and a Co-op which sold odds and ends.
